SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Interface BindInfo

public interface BindInfo
BindInfo objects allow you to determine how values are bound into a PreparedStatement. Ordinarily Klojang JDBC will have enough context to figure this out automatically. However, if you want or need to, this class enables you to override the default behaviour.
Author:
Ayco Holleman

  • Method Details

    • getSqlType

      default Integer getSqlType(Class<?> beanType, String propertyName, Class<?> javaType)
      Allows you to specify the storage type for a property. The return value must either be one of the constants in Types (like VARCHAR) or null. Returning null means you leave it to Klojang JDBC to determine the mapping. The default implementation returns null. You may ignore any argument that you don't need in order to determine the storage type. For example, in many cases the Java type of a property will likely be enough to determine the corresponding SQL type.
      Parameters:
      beanType - the class containing the property whose SQL type to determine
      propertyName - the name of the property whose SQL type to determine
      javaType - the type of the property whose SQL type to determine
      Returns:
      one of the class constants of the Types class or null

    • saveEnumAsString

      default boolean saveEnumAsString(Class<?> beanType, String enumProperty)
      Whether to save enums as strings (by calling their toString() method) or as ints (by calling their ordinal() method). The default implementation return false, meaning that by default Klojang JDBC will save enums as ints. You can ignore any argument that you don't need in order to determine the storage type. To save all enums in your application are strings, simply return true straight away.
      Parameters:
      beanType - the class containing the enum property
      enumProperty - the enum property for which to specify the storage type.
      Returns:
      whether to bind enums as strings or as ints
